action.action-desc: Mrs. Lee of Nevada (for herself and Mr. McKinley) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to make improvements to the redistribution of residency slots under the Medicare program after a hospital closes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Physicians for Underserved Areas Act.

section.header: Improvements to the redistribution of residency slots under the Medicare program after a hospital closes

subsection.text: Section 1886(h)(4)(H)(vi) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(h)(4)(H)(vi)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking item (cc) and redesignating item (dd) as item (cc); and
in item (cc), as redesignated under subparagraph (A)—

clause.text: by striking Fourth and inserting Third; and
by striking item (cc) and inserting item (bb); and

paragraph.text: in subclause (III), by striking likelihood of filling and all that follows and inserting the following: “likelihood of—

item.text: starting to utilize the positions made available under this clause within 2 years; and
filling the positions made available under this clause within 5 years.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to the redistribution of residency slots with respect to hospitals that close on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
